title: If SKT wins S5 Championship, give Easyhoon his own skin!
body:
I know i'm getting ahead of myself on this one, but i think it is pretty clear that if SKT wins the finals, all 6 players should be rewarded with a team skin. Unlike previous years, where all the teams were compose it primarily by 5 members, it is clear that SKT is playing with a 6 man unit through all this months, and even on World Championship Easyhoon has been a key member of the team. So, if their victory is achieve, i hope Riot will give this man the opportunity of picking up a champion to have his own celebratory skin on LoL. 

Since this skins are on most of the cases 750 RP range, having an additional one won't give Riot staff that much work. And it would be a great message about the importance of each member of a competitive team.

Easyhoon deserves it as much as any other member of SKT, and i hope you do the right thing about it! Thanks for reading this.

replies.body:
I agree with this.  Easyhoon is a very skilled player, and unlike other subs for other teams isn't just there to fill in when Faker is out.  He takes the role depending on the situation.

Especially this if Easyhoon starts worlds and wins 2 games before Faker comes to clean up the 3rd round.

I have nothing against Faker, but Easyhoon is a great player and key member of the team too ^_^

Both Faker and Easyhoon are great players, and even if Faker ends up getting all the attention, i think Easyhoon deserves to be recognize as well (i'm pretty sure even Faker knows this).

At times this season he has even been more reliable than Faker(which is mainly just a stylistic difference between what the team asks each of them to do) This guy is up there with Faker, Rookie, Febiven, xPeke, and Bjergsen imo

Indeed, and that's saying a lot for the NA teams. Apart from Bjerg, who really deserved their spots at Worlds? Hai and Incarnation, and maybe Sneaky, along with - arguably - Aphromoo and Doublelift. That's really it, honestly. The entire TSM squad apart from Bjerg really showed their weaknesses, Zion/Pobelter/xmithie showed that, while good, they weren't world-class material, and Balls only got that one Pentakill before becoming largely useless again in the second week. I mean, Zion didn't even do that bad, but he evidently couldn't tango with Smeb, and only did well against FW and PaiN, who aren't exactly the best teams - and even faltering somewhat against Steak (though Steak did really well overall, considering the rest of his team's performances).

Anyway, that's besides the point, really, since Lustboy and Dyrus retired, and Santorin went back to school. So the onus wasn't really on TSM as much as it was their individual decisions. However, their decision to remove Turtle from the main roster? That was a good sign. Showed that the organization knows they have to rebuild TSM from the ground up around Bjergsen.
I'd say Westdoor deserves a mention too; his laning may not be the greatest consistently, but he did give Faker a good beating and his teamfighting is fantastic.
